messages.message: Should we upgrade our Cypress CI orgs to the Enterprise tier? I recently upgraded the internal orgs on sandbox and uat to Enterprise, which also has Cypress test run on it, so i think we should upgrade Cypress CI orgs to match
should we still have some automated way to test the commercial UX though?
are there any tests that check enterprise-only UX? it seems most of our tests that use orgs check only commercial-only UX?

>  should we still have some automated way to test the commercial UX though?
The enterprise org should include all the commercial features. There might be some UX differences between enterprise and commercial. If needed, I can set up another commercial org.

iâ€™m wondering whether we should set up a new enterprise org and keep the current commercial orgs as-is for crafting-aihub

was there a particular reason for making the commercial orgs into enterprise orgs on aihub-sandbox and aihub-uat? was it just for ease of internal testing since most internal users were already added to the existing commercial org?

>  was it just for ease of internal testing since most internal users were already added to the existing commercial org
Yep, Hannah suggested we go for this way because enterprise org should have all the commercial features.

hmm i wish we separated the orgs used for cypress testing vs internal user testing in aihub-sandbox,,,

ok then, i agree it may be easiest to create a new commercial org for cypress testing on aihub-sandbox

this time, it should really be used for only cypress tests :sob: (i know it already says that for the current org admin credentials in 1password lol)

Same... I believe this was because at the time we set up cypress test on sandbox and uat, it was quite difficult to set up commercial orgs. If we know all the set up we need to do, I can create an separate org for cypress on sandbox and uat.
based on the current failing tests on aihub-sandbox, i _think_ only `advanced-apps` relies on manual setup, and i think all the other tests should create the Build/Converse projects they need
